word.w2004.elements
Class BreakLine

java.lang.Object
  word.w2004.elements.BreakLine
All Implemented Interfaces:
IElement, IFluentElement<BreakLine>
public class BreakLine
extends java.lang.Object
implements IElement, IFluentElement<BreakLine>

Breaks lines like when you press enter in your MS Word. You can insert many Breaklines at once. Eg.: new BreakLine(3) This will insert 3 Breaklines. FOR A MATTER OR EXERCICE, THIS CLASS FOLLOWS ALL THOSE CRASY CHECKSTYLE GUIDELINES.

Constructor Summary
BreakLine()
          constructor: By default, 1 Number of break line when no number is provided.

          constructor: Number of break lines you want to add.

Method Detail

getContent

public final java.lang.String getContent()
Description copied from interface: IElement

This method returns the content (XML or HTML) of the Element and the content.

If you are using W2004, the return will be the XML required to generate the element.

Important: Once you call this method, the Document value is cached an no elements can be added later.

Specified by:
getContent in interface IElement
Returns:
this is the String value of the element ready to be appended/inserted in the Document.

This is the XML that generates a BreakLine:
